CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Event Reattendance stage positioned above or below the Fan Engagement stage?
SRP.A: The Event Reattendance stage is positioned {below} the Fan Engagement stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {logarithmic} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Fan Engagement?
VE.A: The value of stage Fan Engagement is {1859}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Post-Event Feedback?
VE.A: The value of stage Post-Event Feedback is {929}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Fan Engagement, with a value of {1859}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Event Reattendance, with a value of {317}.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Merchandise Purchase to stage Event Reattendance?
SC.A: Decreased by {68} Participants from stage Merchandise Purchase to stage Event Reattendance.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Fan Engagement to stage Post-Event Feedback?
SC.A: Decreased by {930} Participants from stage Fan Engagement to stage Post-Event Feedback.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 351? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Fan Engagement} stage has {1859}, the {Post-Event Feedback} stage has {929}, the {Merchandise Purchase} stage has {385}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 1394? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Post-Event Feedback} stage has {929}, the {Merchandise Purchase} stage has {385}, the {Event Reattendance} stage has {317}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 351 and 657? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Post-Event Feedback to Merchandise Purchase, or from stage Merchandise Purchase to Event Reattendance?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Post-Event Feedback} to {Merchandise Purchase} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Merchandise Purchase to Event Reattendance, from stage Fan Engagement to Post-Event Feedback, or from stage Post-Event Feedback to Merchandise Purchase?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Fan Engagement} to stage {Post-Event Feedback} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Fan Engagement} and {Post-Event Feedback} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Merchandise Purchase} and {Event Reattendance} stages.
